title: South Live: Wednesday 27 September - BBC News
summary: weather : a cloudy and misty start , but sunny spells developing .
four people arrested over the shooting of a man in waterlooville are charged .
the white helmets make their final ever public appearance .

documents.title: good evening !
text: that 's it for bbc south live for today .
the service will resume at 08:00 on thursday when we will be bringing you the latest news , travel , weather and sport from across berkshire , dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight and oxfordshire .
you can get in touch anytime with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: boy , 17 , arrested over stab attack in reading
text: a 17-year-old boy has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a man sustained life-threatening injuries in a stabbing in reading .
the victim , in his 20s , was approached by two men in foxhays road at about 22:00 bst on tuesday .
thames valley police said an argument took place , leaving the victim in hospital with stab wounds .
the force added it did not believe it was random .
however , additional patrols have been put in place .
the victim remains in hospital .
police have appealed for any witnesses to the attack to come forward .

documents.title: boomtown festival makes charity donations
text: winchester 's boomtown fair has raised about £ 116,00 for charity with £ 32,000 going to projects in the local area .
the dance music festival 's main charity partner for 2017 was winchester-based youth outreach organisation , street reach .
hampshire and isle of wight air ambulance also received a donation , along with five parishes which neighbour the matterley bowl site .
organisers faced criticism at the start of this year 's event when festival-goers had to queue for six hours to get into the site due to additional searches and bad weather .

documents.title: home office lets syrian musician play in uk
text: the home office said it reversed its decision after `` further representations '' from ibrahim keivo , whose supporters claim their campaign changed the government 's mind .

documents.title: no formal investigation into m3 closure disruption
text: highways england and the department for transport have said no formal investigation is underway into the disruption caused following the closure of the m3 for 11 hours on saturday .
police closed the motorway at winchester following the discovery of a flammable substance thrown from a motorway bridge .
on monday , the agency said it `` routinely reviews '' its performance and would `` act on any opportunities to improve . ''

documents.title: historic palace illuminated at night
text: an exhibition is set to light up blenheim palace from tomorrow .
artist jenny holzer will project the words of war veterans onto the palace walls - she 's previously taken over iconic buildings including jfk airport and new york 's rockefeller centre .
it will cover 90 % of the palace 's facade in the evenings .
light projections will run from 28 to 30 september , and 2 to 10 october from 19:30 bst .

documents.title: police appeal after southampton knife-point robbery
text: cctv : man on bike , knifepoint robbery # newroad outside premier in sat 23 sept 1.30am .
can you help ?
watch

documents.title: appeal over police medal stolen from new forest home
text: a special constable whose medal was stolen in a burglary in the new forest has appealed to the thief to return it .
the long service medal was taken from a house in blissfield during the day on 20 september .
it belonged to cllr ann sevier , who served as a special constable for hampshire constabulary .
cllr sevier said : `` my medal holds all the memories of my 20 years ' service and i am very sad to have had it stolen . ''
appeal for info after police long service medal taken in burglary # blissford , 20 sept .

documents.title: in fond farewell to blandford 's white helmets
text: hundreds of people have lined the streets in blandford forum to watch the white helmets appear in public for the final time .
the motorcycle team is disbanding after 90 years .

documents.title: white helmets parade for final time
text: white helmets parade for final time

documents.title: man robbed by 'gunman ' on common
text: a man has reported that he was robbed by a gunman on southampton common on monday evening .
the 23-year-old was approaching the exit for highfield lane at about 19:30 bst when a man threatened him with what has been described as a handgun .
the offender , who wore a dark red hoodie , seized the victim 's wallet and mobile phone before running away .
police said they had increased patrols in the area to reassure residents .

documents.title: old books and cash needed for libraries
text: a labour-run council has blamed `` severe government cuts '' for its decision to start accepting cash donations from the public to help run libraries .
reading council has also invited residents to give it their second-hand `` best-selling books in good condition '' .
it said it would begin accepting donations from residents on sunday .
alok sharma , reading west 's conservative mp , said the move demonstrated the authority 's `` financial incompetence '' .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: red eagle ferry to get £ 3m revamp
text: a ferry which first saw service in 1996 is to get a £ 3m refurbishment .
the red eagle which travels 45,500 miles every year between southampton and east cowes will undergo an overhaul in southampton in the new year .
the refit will include a new interior with more seats , new loos , a posh club area and a lounge for pets ,
it is expected to be back in service by the end of march .

documents.title: green park station funding approved by reading councillors
text: this ca n't come soon enough # rdguk

documents.title: home office apologises to scientist after sanction threat
text: a home office error led to a scientist being told he had no lawful basis to be in the uk and his driving licence was being revoked .
dr mohsen danaie , an electron microscopy scientist , said he received the letter despite having a valid visa .
he works in oxfordshire at diamond light source , which is partly funded by the uk government .
the home office has apologised for the error and confirmed dr danaie is entitled to be in the uk .
`` we have written to dr danaie to reassure him that he will not face any enforcement action '' , a home office spokesperson added .

documents.title: flood training exercise in romsey
text: a test will be carried out in romsey today to see how emergency teams would deal with a major flood .
the exercise is taking place off greatbridge road where a number of homes and businesses were flooded in february 2014 .
some roads will be closed in the area while a temporary barrier is built - mimicking how the teams would react if water were threatening homes in the area .
the # romsey # flood defence exercise began last night .
it runs all day today and # greatbridge road is closed today from 19:00 to midnight .

documents.title: plea for signs and free parking during wokingham regeneration
text: there are calls for free parking and better signage in wokingham to bring more shoppers into the town centre .
independent retailers say road closures and disruption caused by the regeneration has led to a drop in trade .
the council says it 's looking at various options to help traders and will continue to closely monitor the situation .
work is set to continue for another 12 weeks .
we know the latest market place road closures have caused problems .
we are sorry , but please bear with us .
( cont )
attractive paving ?
is the cheap tarmac temporary ?
got to say i like cheap tarmac that 's well laid , also saves spending 5 months next year laying york stone .
well laid and cost effective is fine but let 's not call it attractive .
but no less attractive than the unfinished pavement on shute end !
shocking management again .
roadworks everywhere not just town centre .
time to get out and come rural karl .
makes curry nights much easier

why close langborough road it would have taken some of the traffic

@ twitterid

has john dedwood the local tory mp had anything to say about this local authorities utter incompetence ?
utter chaos once again this morning

documents.title: man released in southampton rape investigation
text: a 20-year-old man arrested on sus of raping a 19-year-old woman after she left jesters nightclub in southampton has been released while inquiries continue .
# southampton rape investigation update , man released under investigation

documents.title: basingstoke - heathrow rail connection plans revealed
text: plans have been released to link basingstoke on a direct rail line to heathrow for the first time .
heathrow southern railway limited wants to run two trains an hour from basingstoke and guildford .
if it goes ahead the project will cost £ 1.3bn .

documents.title: crowds line the street for white helmets final ride
text: the white helmets have paraded through blandford forum for the final time .
the royal signals motorcycle display team has put on displays for millions of people over the last 90 years .
it is being disbanded as a result of the modernisation of the royal signals and a move to cyber operations .
the team rode through the town watched by hundreds of well-wishers .

documents.title: appeal over st leonards distraction burglary
text: an elderly man has been targeted in a distraction burglary in east dorset .
a man aged in his 30s entered the man 's home at at oak tree park in st leonards last wednesday .
he claimed he had been sent to check the electrics .
the pensioner later found his wallet containing cash had been stolen .
# latestnews - witness appeal following distraction burglary in east dorset

documents.title: live : white helmets in blandford
text: crowds gather in blandford for the last public outing for the white helmets royal signals motorcycle display team .

documents.title: national fitness day # getinspired
text: it 's national fitness day with plenty of fitness centres putting on free taster sessions or open days .
all you need to do to get involved is type in your local postcode into the national fitness day activity finder and see what 's available near you .
if you 're still not sure , we 've put together five suggestions for you .

documents.title: residents have their say on new weymouth seafront lighting
text: all we want is for the lights we had before back '' : residents have their say on the new # weymouth seafront lighting

documents.title: studying football violence could help fight terror
text: there are links between the psychology which underlies football violence and terrorism , researchers at the university of oxford say .
the team investigated fan violence in the uk and three other countries before reviewing the published literature on the subject .
dr martha newson says football violence is `` underpinned '' by shared experiences which creates `` a brother in arms mentality '' .
the team 's review of the literature found gang culture and terrorism was often rooted in a similar feeling .
dr newson says understanding such `` extreme group behaviours '' increases the chances of being able tackle them .

documents.title: sky-high proposal
text: last night , southampton in the sky , a pop-up kitchen suspended 100ft ( 30m ) in the air in the city saw a proposal .
bilal could n't exactly get down on one knee , given the three-point harness but he did pop the question to april who said yes !
it was the last dining flight for the restaurant which has been in the city for the last six days .
she said yes !
massive congrats to these diners on our last dinner in the sky in southampton , who just got engaged !
huge congratulations

documents.title: 'hero ' dog rescues drowning family
text: dave the dog is being hailed a hero after helping to save a family who got into difficulty in the sea off hayling island beach .
nicola 's 14-year-old daughter and 19-year-old niece both were being swept out to sea at the entrance to langstone harbour .
nicola jumped in to help , but got into trouble herself .
luckily for the family , dog walker guy and his son were passing at the time with dave and baxter .

documents.title: hospital plans 'gp surgery ' to help a & e
text: the john radcliffe hospital is planning to set up a portable building outside its emergency department to speed up patient admissions .
the new facility , which will act similarly to a gp surgery , will house up to two doctors and two nurses .
patients will be assessed before going into a & e , or redirected elsewhere .
oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust believes it is needed to `` ease the flow of patients '' around the under pressure department .

documents.title: four charged over waterlooville shooting
text: three men and a woman arrested in connection with a shooting in hampshire have been charged .
jamie sibley suffered a `` life-changing '' head injury in the attack in athena avenue , waterlooville , on 13 february .
jordan perry , 26 , of surrey , jordan smith , 22 , of surbiton , and ricardo livingston-wright , 31 , of brighton , are charged with conspiracy to murder .
sara hodgkinson , 32 , of waterlooville , has been charged with assisting in the commission of an indictable offence .
they are all due before basingstoke magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: reading uni gets self-service beer wall ''
text: reading university has introduced a self-service 16-tap `` beer wall '' at its student union , allowing students to buy beverages with a single tap of their debit or credit card .
the university claims the wall can allow them to increase their capacity to serve more customers .

documents.title: good morning ; )
text: hello and welcome to south live on wednesday 27 september .
we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across berkshire , dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight and oxfordshire until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
